channel.title: New Idea - Gh0stly Robes :O
channel.description:
So I was messing around earlier today and I had the idea of making Gh0stly robes!
What's that you say? Of course they are named after me silly! :P
Check this out. [img]http://img856.imageshack.us/img856/4269/37404926.png[/img]
Post your thoughts. Should these be added in game? If so, should they be given special stats? What bonuses or requirements should they have? Should they be a rare drop or a discontinued?
And before you ask... No, I did not get this idea from RS2. It was actually a bug I came across when I was trying to make a mace wieldable on the torso. Haha.

item.title: New Idea - Gh0stly Robes :O
item.dc:creator: @A_Gh0st A Gh0st
item.description:
@A_Gh0st wrote:

[quote=“imthenull, post:14, topic:416999”][quote author=A Gh0st link=topic=518939.msg3772349#msg3772349 date=1317783365]
Cleako, that is the code to add invisibility? All of it? I thought it would be a lot more than that. [quote author=Crooks link=topic=518939.msg3771578#msg3771578 date=1317733335]

Ghostly robes shouldn’t be invisible they should be transparent black, because it looks extremely stupid to see head floating in air.

[/quote]
How would you make a transparent black sprite?
[/quote]

dont make a transparent sprite, draw the regular sprite with transparency, it’s quite easy[/quote]
Might I ask how I would go about doing this?

Read full topic

item.title: New Idea - Gh0stly Robes :O
item.dc:creator: @cleako cleako
item.description:
@cleako wrote:

Sprites are PNG files but I do not think the sprite editor saves alpha transparencies at all when it converts the PNG to an XML .spr file to be read by the game client.

Yes, all the code does is tell surrounding clients except for yours to not update your player when your player is set to that status.

Read full topic

Ghostly robes shouldn’t be invisible they should be transparent black, because it looks extremely stupid to see head floating in air.
[/quote][/quote]
How would you make a transparent black sprite?

Read full topic

item.title: New Idea - Gh0stly Robes :O
item.dc:creator: @cleako cleako
item.description:
@cleako wrote:

Yes you can. The player exists but the sprites do not appear. You can also see their dot on the mini map and if they speak, their chat appears over what would be their head. When the “DarkQuest” invisible command is used, text displays in the main chat, i’m not sure if it appears over head, the mini map does not show any dot, and you cannot right click on them as the server is instructed not to force surrounding player’s clients to update with the invisible player’s state.

Command Handler:

else if (command.equals("invis")) { if (player.isInvis()) { player.setinvis(false); } else { player.setinvis(true); } player.getActionSender().sendMessage("Invis status is: " + player.isInvis()); }

Player class:

public boolean isInvis() { return invis; }

public void updateViewedPlayers() { List<Player> playersInView = viewArea.getPlayersInView(); for (Player p : playersInView) { if (p.getIndex() != getIndex() && p.loggedIn()) { if (!p.isInvis()) { this.informOfPlayer(p); } if (p.isInvis() && isMod()) { this.informOfPlayer(p); } if (!this.isInvis()) { p.informOfPlayer(this); } } } }

Thats it.

Read full topic

item.title: New Idea - Gh0stly Robes :O
item.dc:creator: @waj waj
item.description:
@waj wrote:

[quote=“CodeForFame, post:9, topic:416999”][quote author=waj link=topic=518939.msg3771765#msg3771765 date=1317756831]

[quote author=CodeForFame link=topic=518939.msg3771743#msg3771743 date=1317754438]

Having tried this, it can be fun but the problem is that players can abuse it while PKing. The traditional mod-only command that sets the player as invisible is better as it can be controlled.

The way to replicate this is invisibility is to set the sprite for the object equipped to 0.
[/quote]Can you still attack the player by clicking where their body would normally be?

Good point lol.
[/quote]… Can you?[/quote]
No idea I wouldn’t waste my time on this shit lol.

Read full topic
